articles.description: Eric Jerome Dickey, bestselling author of books including "Friends and Lovers" and "Milk in My Coffee," died Sunday after a long illness at the age of 59.
articles.content:
Eric Jerome Dickey was a bestselling author whose work depicted modern black life.

articles.title: Albert Roux, Chef Who Brought French Cuisine to London With Le Gavroche, Dies at 85 - The New York Times
articles.description: Mr. Roux and his brother, Michel, opened Le Gavroche in the late 1960s, raising the level of fine dining in the city and offering a training ground for some of the restaurant industry’s future stars.
articles.content:
Mr. Roux and his son had recently opened two restaurants in Scotland, where Mr. Roux liked to go fishing.
